intro: Tithymalus ancyrensis, commonly known as the Armenian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
